snippet: The move was seen as a strong sign that Germany was growing weary of shouldering so much of the burden for Europe’s largest humanitarian crisis in decades.
abstract: Germany orders temporary border restriction, halting rail travel from Austria, in response to large numbers of migrants trying to gain access to country; order is sign that Chancellor Angela Merkel's government is growing tired of shouldering so much of burden, and comes day before European leaders are scheduled to meet in Brussels to create plan to distribute migrants across Continent.

byline.original: By MELISSA EDDY, RICK LYMAN and ALISON SMALE
byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy and Alison Smale reported from Berlin, and Rick Lyman from Warsaw. Reporting was contributed by Andrew Higgins and James Kanter from Brussels, Palko Karasz and Helene Bienvenu from Budapest, and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens.

lead_paragraph: The move was seen as a strong sign that Germany was growing weary of shouldering so much of the burden for Europe’s largest humanitarian crisis in decades.

headline.main: Germany Orders Curbs at Border in Migrant Crisis
headline.print_headline: Germany Orders Curbs at Border in Migrant Crisis

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
